question:
Which of the following were the key British architects of colonial architecture?
1) Robert Fellowes Chisholm
2) Charles Mant
3) Henry Irwin
Select the correct answer from the codes given below:
explanation: Many European countries invaded India and created architectural styles reflective of their ancestral homes. Among the key British architects of this time were Robert Fellowes Chisholm, Charles Mant, Henry Irwin, William Emerson, George Wittet, and Frederick Stevens.
